Data Analysis Toolkit for Food and Nutrition Sciences ðŸ¦›

Welcome to the Toolkit! ðŸ“š

This toolkit is your guide to mastering data analysis for Food and Nutrition Sciences, tailored for MSc students. With a hippo-themed twist (ðŸ¦›), it covers Python basics to advanced Bayesian modelling and qualitative text analysis, using datasets like hippo nutrient intakes.

Explore 27 Jupyter notebooks across six modules, rendered as HTML tutorials. Each module includes exercises, comments, and datasets to build skills for research projects like the National Diet and Nutrition Survey (NDNS).

ðŸ§® Modules

Navigate the modules below. Tutorials will be in _site/notebooks/ after rendering:

  1. Infrastructure (5 notebooks): Set up your data science environment.
    • Example: Getting Started
    • Dataset: notebooks/01_infrastructure/data/hippo_diets.csv
  2. Programming Basics (5 notebooks): Learn Python fundamentals.
    • Example: Syntax and Variables
  3. Data Handling (5 notebooks): Import, clean, and transform data.
    • Example: Importing Data
    • Dataset: notebooks/03_data_handling/data/hippo_nutrients.csv
  4. Data Analysis (6 notebooks): Visualise and analyse data.
    • Example: Logistic Regression and Survival Analysis
    • Dataset: notebooks/04_data_analysis/data/vitamin_trial.csv
  5. Advanced Topics (5 notebooks): Explore Bayesian methods, SQL, and dashboards.
    • Example: Advanced Bayesian Modelling
    • Datasets: notebooks/05_advanced/data/large_food_log.csv, notebooks/03_data_handling/data/hippo_nutrients.csv
  6. Qualitative Research (2 notebooks): Analyse text data.
    • Example: Text Analysis
    • Dataset: notebooks/06_qualitative/data/food_preferences.txt

Note: The _site/ directory contains outdated HTMLs. Delete _site/ and run quarto render to generate fresh tutorials.

ðŸš€ Get Started

  1. Clone the Repo:

    git clone https://github.com/ggkuhnle/data-analysis-toolkit-FNS.git

  2. Install Dependencies:

    pip install -r requirements.txt

    Install Quarto: quarto.org.

  3. Run Notebooks: Start with notebooks/01_infrastructure/0_getting_started.ipynb in Jupyter or Colab.

  4. Render the Site:

    rm -rf _site/
quarto render

    View at _site/index.html.

ðŸ“Š Why This Toolkit?

  • Practical: Real-world nutrition datasets.
  • Educational: Copious comments and exercises.
  • Fun: Hippo-themed examples! ðŸ¦›

Check the Syllabus for details. Happy analysing! ðŸš€
